DataElement.preferredName: Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Tumor Tissue Storage Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the storage temperature at which the formalin fixed paraffin embedded tissue is maintained.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Tumor Tissue Storage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications.  Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke.  Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans. (NCI04)_Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin._Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin_A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Formaldehyde Fixed Specimen Tissue, Paraffin Tumor Tissue
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications.  Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke.  Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans. (NCI04):Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.:Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin:A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

Concepts.definition: The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Kidney Chromophobe form per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 7/16/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of storage for a biologic specimen.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Vapor Phase Cooling or Liquid Nitrogen

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Vapor Phase Cooling or Liquid Nitrogen
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cryogenic process for the storage and/or shipping of biospecimens. The item to be frozen is placed above a shallow reservoir of cooling liquid in a storage vessel. A vertical temperature gradient is maintained throughout the vapor layer to ensure temperatures sufficiently low to maintain the integrity of the stored material._Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to -196 degrees Celsius.

Concepts.definition: A cryogenic process for the storage and/or shipping of biospecimens. The item to be frozen is placed above a shallow reservoir of cooling liquid in a storage vessel. A vertical temperature gradient is maintained throughout the vapor layer to ensure temperatures sufficiently low to maintain the integrity of the stored material.
Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to -196 degrees Celsius.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen that has been kept or preserved at a low temperature in a refrigerator.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been kept or preserved at a low temperature in a refrigerator.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen that has been subjected to and adjusted to the average ambient temperature of a room, usually considered to be around 20 degrees C (68 degrees F).

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and adjusted to the average ambient temperature of a room, usually considered to be around 20 degrees C (68 degrees F).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Regularly and widely used.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: An event or sequence of events that constitute round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.: A refrigerated cabinet or room for preserving materials at or below 32F (0C).

Concepts.definition: Regularly and widely used.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.
A refrigerated cabinet or room for preserving materials at or below 32F (0C).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liquid Nitrogen or Dry Ice or Ultra Low Temperature Freezer

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liquid Nitrogen or Dry Ice or Ultra Low Temperature Freezer
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to about -200 degrees Celsius.: A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat.: A type of freezer that can maintain temperatures between -80 and -86 degrees C.

Concepts.definition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to -196 degrees Celsius.
A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat.
A type of freezer that can maintain temperatures between -80 and -86 degrees C.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat.

Concepts.definition: A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Water frozen in the solid state.

Concepts.definition: Water frozen in the solid state.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
